7.6 No term of this Agreement is enforceable under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 or otherwise by a person who is not a Party to this Agreement.

9.1 This Agreement and any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter, existence, negotiation, validity, termination, breach or enforceability (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.

7.1 This Agreement and any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter shall be resolved by mutual agreement of the parties or, failing such agreement, through any method of dispute resolution deemed appropriate by either party. The prevailing method to resolve dispute shall be resolved through mutual agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the essential part of the Governing Law and Dispute Resolution clause into the 'Miscellaneous' section and then making it completely toothless introduces contradiction and reduces enforceability, making it hard to enforce because it allows either party to choose any dispute resolution method, contradicting the initial arbitration clause and undermining the predictability of dispute resolution.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (General Principles of Enforceability and Clarity)

perturbation.original_text:
9.11 QIWI and OICL hereby irrevocably undertake to at all times maintain an agent with an address in England and Wales for service of process and any other documents in proceedings in England or any other proceedings in connection with   11
 this Agreement, and to keep the other party advised of the identity and address of such agent, for so long as it has any obligations under thisAgreement. Any claim form, request for arbitration, judgement or any other notice of legal process whatsoever shall be sufficiently served on:

 (a) QIWI, if delivered to:

 (i) QIWI plc c/o Law Debenture Corporate Services Limited Fifth Floor 100 Wood Street London EC2V 7EX United Kingdom

or
 (ii) if delivered to the last address notified to OICL as an address for service under this Clause 9.

 (b) OICL, if delivered to:

 (i) Otkritie Capital International Limited 12 Floor, 88 Wood Street London EC2V 7RS United Kingdom

(or to any other registered office in England and Wales of Otkritie Capital International Limited from time to time); or

 (ii) if delivered to the last address notified to QIWI as an address for service under this Clause 9.
perturbation.explanation: This alteration to Clause 8.1 effectively removes the mandatory requirement for both QIWI and OICL to maintain agents for service of process in England and Wales, thus undermining the clarity of service of process and creates a legal contradiction. By removing this mandatory step, it introduces uncertainty about how legal documents should be served, potentially leading to disputes over proper notification and making enforcement of the agreement more difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Civil Procedure Rules (Regarding Service of Process)

perturbation.original_text: 3.5 The Steering Committee shall validly act only at a duly convened meeting with the approval of at least four (4) of the Committee Members present at such meeting. Upon the approval of a proposal by the Steering Committee, the Steering Committee shall present such proposal to the respective governing body of each Otkritie and of QIWI for approval. For the avoidance of doubt, no decision of the Steering Committee shall be binding on the Parties unless, and the Parties are only required to act upon any decision of the Steering Committee if and to the extent that, such decision is properly approved/ratified by the relevant governing bodies of both Otkritie and QIWI.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.5 The Steering Committee shall validly act only at a duly convened meeting with the approval of at least one (1) of the Committee Members present at such meeting. Upon the approval of a proposal by the Steering Committee, the Steering Committee may, or may not present such proposal to the respective governing body of each Otkritie and of QIWI for approval. For the avoidance of doubt, all decisions of the Steering Committee shall be binding on the Parties regardless of whether or not such decision is properly approved/ratified by the relevant governing bodies of both Otkritie and QIWI.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that 'all decisions of the Steering Committee shall be binding on the Parties regardless of whether or not such decision is properly approved/ratified', there is a clear contradiction, because it is not needed for respective approval or ratification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (Principles of Agency and Authority)
